solution.text:
by multiplying \(sec^2\theta\) to the expression in the bracket
we get,\(_{{j*l}}_(sec^2\theta-sec^2\theta\times sin^2\theta)+_{{2*k*l}}_\over _{j}_+_{{2*k}}_(sec^2\theta-sec^2\theta\times sin^2\theta)\)
We know, \(sec\theta=1\over cos\theta\) and \(sin\theta\over cos\theta\)=\(tan\theta\) and \(sec^2\theta-tan^2\theta=1\)
therefore we have, \(_{{j*l}}_\times(1)+_{{2*k*l}}_\over _{j}_+_{{2*k}}_\times(1)\)
\(_{{j*l}}_+_{{2*k*l}}_\over _{j}_+_{{2*k}}_\)=\(_{{l}}_\)

content.text:
Simplify the expression given below by using the identity \(sec^2\theta-tan^2\theta=1\)
\(_{{j*l}}_sec^2\theta(1-sin^2\theta)+_{{2*k*l}}_\over _{j}_+_{{2*k}}_sec^2\theta(1-sin^2\theta)\)
